amendment.description: Amendment sought to reduce Air Force Aircraft Procurement funding by $331 million in order to eliminate production of 9 B-2 bombers; increase National Guard and Reserve Equipment funding by $105 million for Air National Guard KC-135 aircraft; increase Defense Health Program funding by $12 million for the Army breast cancer research program; and apply $202 million toward deficit reduction.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to eliminate the $331 million appropriation in the bill to begin advanced procurement of an additional 9 B-2 Bombers. Funds would be transferred to other procurement accounts, the Army Breast Cancer Research Progam and applied to deficit reduction.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Obey amendment (A003) Failed by recorded vote: 200 - 222 (Roll no. 336).
